ratings.comment: Worst teacher I have no doubt.  He rambles about a specific problem for ten minutes that he does mostly in his head, and then gets it wrong in the end.  Switch out ASAP don't make my mistake.
Worst professor I've had so far. He spent more time rambling about the square root of 2 than teaching calc.

Screws you with the curve at the end. Curve was completely unreasonable compared to other 221 professors. 15% A unbelievably small AB range. Next 30% B. Too tough of a curve for science and math major calculus. DO NOT TAKE.

He just cannot teach the principles of calculus well; I am sure that he is very knowledgeable, but he cannot convey that information to students in a relatively easy manner.  I like his personality.  His exams are relatively easy if you master the homework problems.

If you have to chose between having Arnold as your lecturer and not taking the class, DONT TAKE THE CLASS. If you have any common sense, do not take anything he's teaching. He gives tenured teachers a bad name. Time to retire, Arnie

Everything he goes over in class is useless and will probably only make the class harder for you, so don't bother. He is incapable of explaining concepts in multiple ways (which made epsilon/delta proofs impossible), and unless you have previous experience or a good TA, you'll end up lost. Avoid it.

First off, if this is your first time taking calc, good luck! Although the exams are very similar to the homework, they're still difficult since he doesn't teach the material very well. If he does a long problem and gets the wrong answer, he won't fix his answer but will instead move on and forget about it. He's a good guy, but a bad teacher.

He is really old-fashioned professor who likes to joke about the mathematics.  Class is not that hard, as long as doing homework consistently and studying hard.  Overall, he is a good professor but not the best of there is.

Loves to do his stupid little proofs on board in lecture, which aren't helpful. Can't say this enough, DO THE HOMEWORK, exams are straight from it. No need to attend lecture. Don't fall behind, or its tough to catch up. Moves quickly. Good Luck.

He treats an intro calc class as if students have a lot of prior calculus experience. He flew through elementary derivatives and integrals and went straight for difficult material. If you haven't been exposed to calc, this will be hard. He trails off a lot and often messes up his own examples and never fixes them.  I cannot recommend him to anyone.
He makes no sense in lecture and if you don't get a good TA or have taken calc AB in high school this class will be really hard

In lecture you often will be confused about what he is talking about, but if you go to discussion and do the homework, his exams are a breeze. He never expects you to do anything that you haven't seen multiple times.

All I can say is, you better have taken Calculus AB in high school or have a really good TA.  Going to lecture doesn't help much.  However, his exam problems are straight from the homework, so do the 10 or so homework problems after lecture and go to your TA's office hours and you'll be fine.
Lecture is essentially pointless.  He just goes over proofs the whole time.  Exams are pretty straight forward and are right from exams so study a lot and you'll be fine.

My number one problem is that he mumbles half of the things he says. Sit in the front if you want to hear him. He doesn't seem to care about the subject much, and if you get lost during an example, there's no hope for you. Exam problems come STRAIGHT from the homework, some actually word for word. I highly recommend redoing hw problems to study.
Nice guy. Lectures were kind of dry, but his exams were fair. If you can get a better prof do it, but he's not one to dread.

Doesn't teach well in the sense of helping you learned. I passed solely because of my TA. He uses an online textbook which is as equally as confusing, yet he takes all the problems for homework. Switch if you can.

Nearly impossible to comprehend what he's saying in lecture. He also makes multiple mistakes and goes on long tangents that have nothing to do with anything. Spends most of the time in lecture doing proofs. Homework is important tho bc exams are based off it. Exams aren't too hard.

Not a good teacher. Wastes time doing proofs and doesn't teach how to do the actual problems. Most of the homework he assigns was not covered in lecture and you have to teach yourselves, however the hw is super important because all the tests are based on it.  The only reason I did well in this class is because I went to my TA every week.

Found him extremely difficult to understand. Eventually gave up trying to make sense of what he was saying during lectures and relied on discussion sessions. I only survived because my TA was pretty good and because the exams were pretty easy.
He is very knowledgeable and funny. His voice squeaks a lot and he likes to make math jokes.

Sort of a character, shows up to class every day in overalls or a sweatshirt, and comes off like your slightly cranky grandfather, who still lives in the good old days.  Subject matter is hard, but he does a fair job explaining.  Makes mistakes in work on occasion, and asks students to point them out, so the lecture environment is a positive one.

He has no desire to teach in the world. He'll do really long problems, then give up on them because he's lazy and doesn't want to put in the effort to finish. When you ask questions he makes you feel like you're wasting his time. Mumbles so it's hard to hear. Worst math prof I've ever had. Only good thing is notes make tests easy.

He had never taught 131 before and had no clue what he was doing. He's a nice guy but a terrible prof overall, and constantly goes off on tangents in lecture and talks about stuff you'll never be tested on and don't have to know. The tests were pretty easy, and it was an easy A, but he made class unbearable for a semester; horrible professor!

whenever the lecture began, he flew right into the new information, never kinda had a small refresher or anything. he writes a lot on the board and its hard to follow. if you fall behind at all, its really hard to catch up. i found it difficult to pay attention with him, just not at all engaging...but maybe thats what calculus is.

Here's the real deal with Miller:His lectures are unclear and all over the place, but his examples do supplement the homework. DO THE HOMEWORK!! Can't be stressed enough. I taught myself most of the material by reading the textbook which was pretty clear. If you don't understand the stuff from the book hope you have a good TA.Tests aren't that bad.
not a very good teacher - in class he talks about the theoretical stuff and his examples make basically no sense.  however, the TAs for the class are very good.  lecture is just pointless though

Easy if you remember it's a 5 credit class, which means it may take a little more effort than a 3 credit 100 level class.  Midterms a joke.  The overall curve makes it impossible to do poorly.  No need to go to lecture... ever.

This professor is by far the worst professor I have ever had in my entire life.  Math has always been my strongst subject but since entering his class and failing I've had to enroll in the terrific (not sarcastic) tutorial program.  His final was IMPOSSIBLE.  He makes no sense and always makes mistakes!! DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!
As long as you practice homework the professor assigns very often, you should be fine with the class.

What I learned in this class:  doing crossword puzzles > listening to Miller talk.  Lectures are extremely dull and pointless but the class is seriously easy.  Midterms were a joke and the curve was extremely generous.. I'd highly recommend this class if you need 3 easy math credits.

I taught myself everything out of the book in the class because his lectures were so bad.  The test problems were not extremely difficult but there were too many problems to finish them all if not rushing.

Honestly the easiest class I've taken so far.  Just do the daily 20 minutes of homework and you'll be fine...exams tend to be easier than a lot of the problems in homework.  He does a good job teaching the material, and while he isn't perfect, for this course he does a fine job.  He's willing to help clarify too, if you need extra help.
Pretty easy class.  Let class leave early a lot.  Just wrote out his notes which helped understanding of homework sometimes.  Funny looking and made a few geeky jokes.
miller is a decent professor.  some of the lectures are beyond boring.  some days he let us out of lecture up to 25 min early!  exams are fair.  gives you a 8.5" x 11" cheat sheet on final!
He isn't hard and he curves pretty well...but then again I like Math.  Lectures are pretty boring
All the mistakes in lecture kind of made it hard to follow the proofs.  If something didn't look right, I didn't know if it was because it was just that complicated or if it really wasn't right.

Miller is an excellent all around professor.  Who cares what the guy wears to class anyway?  He is easy to follow in lecture and is interesting.  He makes a few mistakes in examples here and there, but if you pay attention in class it's a pretty easy
I agree, today in review lecture he also said "...you have to do it right, but I cant" because he makes sooo many mistakes in doing his own examples, that he has written down on a sheet of paper!

Quote: "My method seems correct, but arthimtic is off...good enough you guys can figure it out." He said something like this every problem in a review lecture, and is not very motivated to provide correct or clear answers. Definately need TA hel
Cannot do any of his own examples and makes way too many mistakes in class. If it weren't for high quality TA's I would not have a clue in this class. By the way suspender's are out of style.
Definately brings back suspenders. Gets confused and mumbles when asked questions. Makes confusing and difficult assumptions. Definately need TA help although somewhat limited during a strike.
Great teacher, lectures easy to follow, he goes a little fast but as long as you pay attention you'll do fine.  Can be unclear at times, but TA's are great.  Loved the class.
Helpful, explains things well.
Has 2 outfits.  Goes way too fast.  Quote from this professor: "Maybe the entire universe is made of a bunch of springs."  ???

Very friendly teacher, however, he's quiet and likes to start class right away. Occassionally he strays from the textbook, which can make things hard. Can be unclear when answering questions in class. Overall, good teacher.
